Question: What is the unit of force?
What is the chemical symbol for gold?
What is the substance that provides energy to cells?
What is the speed of light in a vacuum?
What is the most reactive metal?
What is the powerhouse of the cell?
What is the law of conservation of energy?
Answer: Energy cannot be created or destroyed| only transformed
Distractor1: Energy can be created or destroyed

Question: What element has the symbol N?
What is the process by which plants convert sunlight into energy?
What is the force that opposes motion?
What is the state of matter in which the molecules have the least energy?
What is the smallest unit of life?
What is the force that keeps planets in orbit around the sun?
What is the most abundant element in the universe?
What is the substance that carries genetic information?
What is the law of inertia?
Answer: An object at rest will stay at rest and an object in motion will stay in motion with the same speed and direction| unless acted upon by an unbalanced force
Distractor1: An object at rest will stay at rest
Distractor2: An object in motion will stay in motion
Distractor3: An object in motion will eventually come to a stop

Question: What is the state of matter in which the molecules have the most energy?

What is the process by which cells make more of themselves?
What is the force that causes objects to float in water?
What is the state of matter in which the molecules are closely packed together and have a fixed shape?
What is the process by which animals exchange gases with their environment?
What is the law of action and reaction?
Answer: For every action| there is an equal and opposite reaction
Distractor1: For every action| there is a larger reaction
Distractor2: The larger the action| the smaller the reaction

What is the force that causes objects to repel each other if they have the same charge?
